text: Goldie is a 1931 American pre-Code black-and-white romantic comedy film. The script was written by Paul Perez and Gene Towne, and directed by Benjamin Stoloff. It was made before the Hays Code was rigidly enforced. It is a remake of Howard Hawks' 1928 silent film, A Girl in Every Port.The AFI Catalog of Feature Films:..Goldie ==Plot== In every port, sailor Bill (Spencer Tracy) meets girls, who sailor Spike (Warren Hymer) has already met, and talked into getting his signature tattoo. When Bill and Spike finally meet, they become friends.
